document_data.name: Swordstars Lane
document_data.mainbody: The '''Swordstars Lane''' was a short street thats began on [[Stonebow Street]] and took on a Y-shape with its left end reaching the [[Society of Stalwart Adventurers]] and that right end merged with the [[Coachwheels Way]].{{cite web| url = https://web.archive.org/web/20220313034753/https://candlekeep.com/library/articles/sse/sse_080910-04.htm| title = So Saith Ed Aug – Oct 2004 | accessdate = 13-04-2021| date = 13-04-2021}}
document_data.Notable Locations:
*[[Jharko's Coffers and Crates]], a poor [[rat]]-infested shop that sold secondhand coffers, chests, and other containers. It was the third building north of Jhassalan warehouse. It was separated from its northern neighbor – Montalar's Happy House, by a small but busy cart alley.
*[[Jhassalan warehouse]] that sold aromatic [[oil]]s and [[perfume]]s. It belonged to a merchant [[Jhassalan (family)|Jhassalan]] family. The warehouse stood on the northwestern corner of the intersection of Stonebow Street and the Swordstars Lane.
*[[Montalar's Happy House]], a crowded dawn-to-dusk eatery that did not allow local drunkards and troublemakers in.
*[[Talarkgates]], an old and decaying manor behind Montalar's Happy House that once before the late 14{{th}} century DR belonged to [[Umbran Daerith]], a merchant, property investor, and moneylender.
*[[Vardrim's rooming-house]], an always-packed rooming-house that housed carters, crate-makers, and warehouse workers. The rooming-house was ran by [[Bardra Vardrim|Bardra "Battleaxe" Vardrim]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]]. Vardrim's was the nestor building to Jhassalan warehouse's north.
